Moreover, the same isle is always wont to have an abbot that is a priest to be the ruler, to whose law both the whole district 1 and also the bishops them- selves ought, after an unaccustomed order, to be subject, according to the example of that first teacher who was no bishop, but a priest and a monk 2 of whose life and sayings the report is that some things remain written by his scholars.2 But yet what manner of man so ever he was, we know this of him for a surety, that he left successors, men that excelled in con- tinency and love of God and practice of religious life : in observing in deed the time of the high feast of Easter they followed uncertain cycles‚ and no marvel, considering that, being men set so far removed from the rest of the world, no man sent unto them the decrees made in synods³ for the keeping thereof : they diligently observed only such works of devotion and chaste conversation as they could learn in the Prophets‚ the Gospels and in the Apostles’ writings. Now this keeping of Easter remained no small time with them, that is to wit, until the 715th year of the Lord's incarnation, by the space of 150 years.
